natural solution: Squaring the given expression, we have \[\begin{aligned} \left(\sqrt{5+\sqrt{21}}+\sqrt{5-\sqrt{21}}\right)^2 &= (5+\sqrt{21}) + (5-\sqrt{21}) + 2\sqrt{(5+\sqrt{21})(5-\sqrt{21})} \\ &= 10 + 2\sqrt{4} \\ &= 14.
\end{aligned}\]Because the given expression is clearly positive, its value must be $\boxed{\sqrt{14}}.$
